alert.note: Alert for Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 12:40PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY PRECIPITATION POSSIBLE FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT... A developing low in the Gulf of Alaska looks to bring potentially heavy precipitation to the area starting Wednesday morning and lasting through Friday morning. Warm, moisture laden air overrunning cold air in place across Prince of Wales Island will result in accumulating snow with rain for most of the island. 2 to 5 inches of snow is expected to fall during a 24-hour period with potentially higher amounts possible. The highest snow totals are expected on northern Prince of Wales Island as well as on the higher elevations of the road system. Rain mixing in with the snow may limit snow totals especially Wed afternoon and evening.
